Text: 1/I dont think this is accurate; IMO it is a function of predominantly L/S equity PMs viewing yearend px action and… https://t.co/nE1ykaY6Hk

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 2/While year-end equity px action was to a certain degree as befuddling/thin as described, this week -as much as mkt ever can-‘”made sense”

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 3/Unexpected policy/other moves by the Chinese caused CNH price action that went against massively one-sided macro fund positioning

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 4/The violence of that move also rippled through macro fund risk models, compounding loss-driven de-risking in other popular macro trades

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 5/And so JPY, KRW, EUR et al reversed initial ’17 pop violently and rates ripped in, with each move in one feeding the fury elsewhere

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 6/And guess what equity sectors those same macro funds were severely long? Financials, Steels, Energy – and so pain there as well…

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 7/...hitting L/S platform shop industrials books (most long steels/energy, short those same pricey industrials) +others similarly positioned

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 8/At same time, some (less prevalent than the long positioning) of those macro funds + many generalist funds have been tilting short FANG...

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 9/And so domino-ing weak-hand covering came just as TMT funds had (finally) passed some brutal year-end redemption-driven selling

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 10/So voila! Crowded macro+Trump equity sector trades selloff, industrials squeeze, TMT rallies...but a major fundamental event was trigger

Name: SmallCapLS
Text: 11/This is a gross oversimplification, but FWIW it is how I see it. Head scratcher was strength of Chinese action. Positioning did the rest
